description: Mid 18th century: from Leghorn (“Livorno”), the place the straw and fowls were imported from.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A type of dried plaited wheat straw fabric.
(countable) A type of hat made from Leghorn straw.
examples: When straw-hats had become unfashionable, Mrs. Nollekens hinted to old White, the hatter  […] , that possibly he could accommodate her with a Leghorn hat at a moderate rate.

entries.meaning: (countable) A small white chicken of a hardy breed.
